verses.kjv: Now about that time Herod the king stretched forth his hands to vex certain of the church.
verses.ct: Around that time, King Herod began to persecute some members of the church.

verses.kjv: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.
verses.ct: He had James, the brother of John, executed by the sword.

verses.kjv: And because he saw it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to take Peter also. (Then were the days of unleavened bread.)
verses.ct: When he saw that this pleased the Jewish leaders, he went ahead and arrested Peter too. This happened during the Festival of Unleavened Bread.

verses.kjv: And when he had apprehended him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him; intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people.
verses.ct: After seizing him, he threw him in prison and assigned 4 squads of 4 soldiers each to guard him, planning to put him on public trial after the Passover festival.

verses.kjv: Peter therefore was kept in prison: but prayer was made without ceasing of the church unto God for him.
verses.ct: So Peter was held in prison, but the church was praying to God for him constantly.

verses.kjv: And when Herod would have brought him forth, the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and the keepers before the door kept the prison.
verses.ct: The night before Herod planned to bring him out, Peter was sleeping between 2 soldiers, chained to them with 2 chains, while additional guards stood watch at the prison entrance.

verses.kjv: And, behold, the angel of the Lord came upon him, and a light shined in the prison: and he smote Peter on the side, and raised him up, saying, Arise up quickly. And his chains fell off from his hands.
verses.ct: Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared, and a light filled the cell. The angel tapped Peter on the side and woke him up, saying, "Get up quickly!" Immediately the chains dropped off Peter's wrists.

verses.kjv: And the angel said unto him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals. And so he did. And he saith unto him, Cast thy garment about thee, and follow me.
verses.ct: The angel told him, "Get dressed and put on your sandals." Peter did so. Then the angel said, "Wrap your cloak around you and come with me."

verses.kjv: And he went out, and followed him; and wist not that it was true which was done by the angel; but thought he saw a vision.
verses.ct: Peter followed him out, but he didn't realize that what the angel was doing was actually happening. He thought he was seeing a vision.

verses.kjv: When they were past the first and the second ward, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city; which opened to them of his own accord: and they went out, and passed on through one street; and forthwith the angel departed from him.
verses.ct: They passed the first guard post, then the second, and came to the iron gate leading into the city. It swung open by itself. They walked through it and down one street, and then suddenly the angel left him.

verses.kjv: And when Peter was come to himself, he said, Now I know of a surety, that the LORD hath sent his angel, and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and from all the expectation of the people of the Jews.
verses.ct: When Peter finally came to his senses, he said, "Now I'm certain that the LORD sent his angel and rescued me from Herod's grasp and from everything the Jewish people were expecting to happen to me."

verses.kjv: And when he had considered the thing, he came to the house of Mary the mother of John, whose surname was Mark; where many were gathered together praying.
verses.ct: Once he realized what had happened, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John who was also called Mark. A large group had gathered there and were praying.

verses.kjv: And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel came to hearken, named Rhoda.
verses.ct: Peter knocked at the outer door, and a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer it.

verses.kjv: And when she knew Peter’s voice, she opened not the gate for gladness, but ran in, and told how Peter stood before the gate.
verses.ct: She recognized Peter's voice, and she was so overjoyed that instead of opening the door, she ran back inside and announced that Peter was standing outside.

verses.kjv: And they said unto her, Thou art mad. But she constantly affirmed that it was even so. Then said they, It is his angel.
verses.ct: They told her, "You're out of your mind!" But she kept insisting it was true. So they said, "It must be his angel."

verses.kjv: But Peter continued knocking: and when they had opened the door, and saw him, they were astonished.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, Peter kept knocking. When they finally opened the door and saw him, they were completely stunned.

verses.kjv: But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, Go shew these things unto James, and to the brethren. And he departed, and went into another place.
verses.ct: He motioned with his hand for them to be quiet, and then he explained how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. He said, "Tell James and the brothers about this." Then he left and went somewhere else.

verses.kjv: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.
verses.ct: When morning came, there was a huge commotion among the soldiers over what had happened to Peter.

verses.kjv: And when Herod had sought for him, and found him not, he examined the keepers, and commanded that they should be put to death. And he went down from Judaea to Caesarea, and there abode.
verses.ct: Herod searched for him but couldn't find him. So he interrogated the guards and ordered their execution. After that, Herod left Judea and traveled down to Caesarea, where he stayed.

verses.kjv: And Herod was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon: but they came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus the king’s chamberlain their friend, desired peace; because their country was nourished by the king’s country.
verses.ct: Now Herod had been furious with the people of Tyre and Sidon. So they came to him together as a group, and after winning over Blastus, the king's personal assistant, they asked for peace, because their region depended on the king's territory for its food supply.

verses.kjv: And upon a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne, and made an oration unto them.
verses.ct: On the appointed day, Herod put on his royal robes, sat on his throne, and delivered a speech to them.

verses.kjv: And the people gave a shout, saying, It is the voice of a god, and not of a man.
verses.ct: The crowd began shouting, "This is the voice of a god, not a human being!"

verses.kjv: And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.
verses.ct: Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him down because he accepted the praise instead of giving glory to God. He was consumed by worms and died.

verses.kjv: But the word of God grew and multiplied.
verses.ct: But the word of God continued to spread and increase.

verses.kjv: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled their ministry, and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.
verses.ct: Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem after completing their mission, bringing along John, who was also called Mark.
